hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout Regime Shift
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC 20-day realized volatility falls below its 60-day rolling 20th percentile (compression) AND the 5-day average daily range is below 2.5%, a breakout above the 20-day Bollinger Band upper bound on expanding volume (>1.5x 20-day average) signals transition from NEUTRAL to BULL regime with 72-hour persistence.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended volatility compression often precedes significant directional moves. Low daily ranges indicate indecision that resolves with expansion. Breakout above Bollinger Band with volume confirms institutional accumulation and regime shift initiation.
entry_conditions: BTC 20-day realized volatility < 20th percentile of 60-day rolling window
BTC price closes above 20-day Bollinger Band upper bound (2 std dev)
Volume on breakout day > 1.5x 20-day average volume

exit_conditions.time_exit: 72 hours after entry if no regime confirmation (BTC fails to maintain >3% above breakout level)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of such breakouts fail to sustain >3% gains within 72 hours OR lead to immediate mean reversion below 20-day MA within 5 trading days.
